caption.p: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center Grading Criteria for Cytokine Release Syndrome

tr.td: Mild symptoms, requiring observation or symptomatic management only (eg, antipyretics, antiemetics, pain medications)
Moderate symptoms: hypotension requiring vasopressors for <24 h or hypoxia or dyspnea requiring supplemental oxygen <40% (up to 6 L by nasal cannula)
Severe symptoms: hypotension requiring vasopressors for ≥24 h or hypoxia or dyspnea requiring supplemental oxygen ≥40%
Life-threatening symptoms: hypotension refractory to vasopressors or hypoxia or dyspnea requiring mechanical ventilation
